text: The people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah and made him king in his father’s place in Jerusalem.

<st data-num="03099" class="">Jehoahaz</st> was <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04427" class="">became king</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">months</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">prevented</st> him <st data-num="05493" class="">from ruling</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> and <st data-num="06064" class="">imposed on</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="06064" class="">a special tax</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and a <st data-num="03603" class="">talent</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.
The king of Egypt made Jehoahaz’s brother Eliakim king over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. Necho seized his brother Jehoahaz and took him to Egypt.
Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. He did evil in the sight of the Lord his God.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05019" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> <st data-num="05921 05927">attacked</st> him,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0631" class="">bound</st> him with <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze chains</st>, and <st data-num="01980" class="">carried</st> him <st data-num="01980" class="">away</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.
Nebuchadnezzar took some of the items in the Lord’s temple to Babylon and put them in his palace there.

The rest of the events of Jehoiakim’s reign, including the horrible sins he committed and his shortcomings, are recorded in the Scroll of the Kings of Israel and Judah. His son Jehoiachin replaced him as king.
Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem. He did evil in the sight of the Lord.

At the beginning of the year King Nebuchadnezzar ordered him to be brought to Babylon, along with the valuable items in the Lord’s temple. In his place Nebuchadnezzar made Jehoiachin’s relative Zedekiah king over Judah and Jerusalem.
Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he ruled for eleven years in Jerusalem.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord his God. He did not humble himself before Jeremiah the prophet, the Lord’s spokesman.
He also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him vow allegiance in the name of God. He was stubborn and obstinate and refused to return to the Lord God of Israel.
All the leaders of the priests and people became more unfaithful and committed the same horrible sins practiced by the nations. They defiled the Lord’s temple which he had consecrated in Jerusalem.
The Lord God of their ancestors continually warned them through his messengers, for he felt compassion for his people and his dwelling place.
But they mocked God’s messengers, despised his warnings, and ridiculed his prophets. Finally the Lord got very angry at his people and there was no one who could prevent his judgment.

He <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> them the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonians</st>, who <st data-num="02026 02719">slaughtered</st><n id="1" /> their <st data-num="0970" class="">young men</st> in their <st data-num="01004 04720">temple</st>.<n id="2" /> He did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02550 05921">spare</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0970 01330">young</st> <st data-num="0970" class="">men</st> or <st data-num="01330" class="">women</st>, or even the <st data-num="02205" class="">old</st> and <st data-num="03486" class="">aging</st>. God<n id="4" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">handed</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">everyone</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">over</st> to him.
He carried away to Babylon all the items in God’s temple, whether large or small, as well as what was in the treasuries of the Lord’s temple and in the treasuries of the king and his officials.

They <st data-num="08313" class="">burned down</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> and <st data-num="05422" class="">tore down</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="08313 0784">burned</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="0759" class="">fortified buildings</st> and <st data-num="07843" class="">destroyed</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="04261" class="">valuable</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">items</st>.

He <st data-num="01540" class="">deported</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> <st data-num="07611 04480">all who escaped</st> the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st>. They <st data-num="01961 05650">served</st> him and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="06539" class="">Persian</st> <st data-num="04438" class="">kingdom</st> <st data-num="04427" class="">rose to power</st>.

This took place to fulfill the Lord’s message spoken through Jeremiah and lasted until the land experienced its sabbatical years. All the time of its desolation the land rested in order to fulfill the seventy years.

In the first year of King Cyrus of Persia, in fulfillment of the Lord’s message spoken through Jeremiah, the Lord motivated King Cyrus of Persia to issue a proclamation throughout his kingdom and also to put it in writing. It read:

“This is what King Cyrus of Persia says:

‘The Lord God of heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth. He has appointed me to build a temple for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Anyone of his people among you may go up there, and may the Lord his God be with him.’”
